name: deimosrising
text: Still funny, still character development.

text: Yes. Maybe the funniest Cornelius joint. Onstad's being modest.

text: Despite the Janet book title being as redundant as "Billie : The Bird with Feathers".

name: invidious
text: Agreed; if you don't find Janet: The Girlfriend Who Could Only Ever Complain and Chug-A-Lug: The Train who Drank to be two of the funniest book titles in the history of creation, you are dead inside.

text: who keeps laming these replies? People are fucking annoying. Not JUST girlfriends, but the Venn diagram has some heavy overlap.

name: professoryes
text: Writing a children's book to tell your girlfriend she's a complaining harpy is either extremely classy or schizophrenic. Since it's Cornelius, there is only one option.

name: boredom_man
text: I agree with all of of your words except or

name: shutup_shutup
text: Yup.  It's either extremely classy schizophrenic.

text: No. Not really. Not if you try.

text: more importantly, is the girlfriend iris, his first wife?  or did the girlfriend come later?

text:
Seems like Mr. Bear went through a rough patch in his career.
"'Twas a woman who drove me to drink. I never had the courtesy to thank her." -W.C. Fields

text: The Janet book and cover just makes it for me. I want to make that into a nametag for some people.

text:

i've dated janet.

text: Its a slipper slope from Chug-a-Lug to Breast Attack on Fuck Mountain captioning, but Cornelius Bear has handled it with grace, as he does all things.

text: Cornelius, who could virtually be considered an anthropomorphic animal, writes children's books featuring anthropomorphic animals?  I would expect the children's books of anthropomorphic animals to feature, I don't know, monkeys.

I think you'll find he's an overweight emo with standard skinny black jeans.

This comic sees into the FUTURES... or Onstad was just drawing a Piggy Goth.

text: Actually with a chain linked to his keys and some suspenders he COULD be entirely Punk.
